results.title: Despair in Mariupol’s last stronghold: ‘They’re bombing us with everything’
results.abstract: A huge Soviet-era steel mill is where the last Ukrainian defenders of Mariupol have taken refuge as Russia’s battle to take full control of the city appeared to be entering its final stages.
results.byline: By Michael Schwirtz, Cora Engelbrecht and Andrew E. Kramer

multimedia.caption: Smoke rose over the Azovstal steel plant in Mariupol on Monday. The plant, where Ukrainian defenders are holding out, is a four-square-mile complex with a network of underground spaces.
Smoke rose over the Azovstal steel plant in Mariupol on Monday. The plant, where Ukrainian defenders are holding out, is a four-square-mile complex with a network of underground spaces.
Smoke rose over the Azovstal steel plant in Mariupol on Monday. The plant, where Ukrainian defenders are holding out, is a four-square-mile complex with a network of underground spaces.

results.title: Ukrainian Children and Caregivers Are Being Separated at U.S. Border
results.abstract: Under a policy designed to protect young refugees from trafficking, Ukrainian children are being temporarily removed from caretakers who are not their parents.

multimedia.caption: Iryna Merezhko and her husband, Vadym Merezhko, must send a reunification packet to a case manager in order for their nephew to be released from U.S. authorities after crossing the border. For 10 days they did not know where he was.
multimedia.copyright: Mark Abramson for The New York Times

results.title: The U.S. Races to Arm Ukraine With Heavier, More Advanced Weaponry
results.abstract: Washington and its allies are scouring Central Europe and the world to get Ukraine the weapons it needs for the next phase of the war.
results.byline: By Steven Erlanger, Eric Schmitt and Julian E. Barnes

multimedia.caption: Ukrainian service members unpacking Javelin anti-tank missiles in Kyiv in February. The missiles were part of the U.S. military support package.
Ukrainian service members unpacking Javelin anti-tank missiles in Kyiv in February. The missiles were part of the U.S. military support package.

results.title: With Joy and Fear, Americans Watch Sweeping Mask Rules Vanish
results.abstract: Many travelers removed their masks after a judge struck down a federal mandate for public transit. Health experts voiced concern, but President Biden said it was now up to individuals.
results.byline: By Jack Healy and Mitch Smith

multimedia.caption: Passengers in Chicago on Tuesday, a day after a judge lifted a federal mask mandate on public transit.
multimedia.copyright: Jamie Kelter Davis for The New York Times

results.title: Biden Administration May Appeal Ruling That Voided Travel Mask Mandate
results.abstract: If the C.D.C. decides there is a public health basis for trying to reinstate and extend the mask mandate, the Justice Department will swiftly file an appeal.
results.byline: By Sheryl Gay Stolberg and Charlie Savage
org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

multimedia.caption: Commuters at Union Station in Washington on Tuesday, one day after a Florida federal judge struck down the mask mandate for public transportation.
multimedia.copyright: Kenny Holston for The New York Times
